author: joshd4078
content:
For those of you considering attending Devconnect, tickets for the co-work space were released today. We will likely be providing tickets to <@&857649635274915900> but you might considering securing one, just in case. They are 10 euro.

https://devconnect.org/cowork

author: bchain99
content: Would it be possible for you to expand more on the kind of support fellows would get for DevConnect? We might have to start planning air tickets etc to get better deals üôÇ

author: joshd4078
content: Fellows will be provided with air travel and hotel accommodations for the duration of the event.

author: ameya
content: Nice. Was also curious about retroactive funding for permissionless fellows. Are you planning it this year as well?

author: joshd4078
content: Yes, we are planning to take a look at retroactive stipends in the next couple of weeks, once projects are underway.

author: mohasdev
content: is the source code of a project need to be opensource ? <@686695036733227017> <@914307919699406908>

author: joshd4078
content: Yes, all EPF projects should be created in an open source manner

author: mohasdev
content: Ok thank you for the answer, I asked the question cause my project is  security related and if its opensource it can help people with bad intentions

author: gbolahan
content: Hnnm, interesting

author: mohasdev
content: its the fuzzing project

author: mohasdev
content: there is public fuzzer online but asked cause i saw that one got private (the one by sigma prime) because the fuzzer has found many crits.

author: mariohavel
content: In case you find some vulnerability, follow disclosure policy of the relevant project. But all the tooling etc needs to be free and open, check for example https://choosealicense.com to find what license suits your project
